Description: This super easy, budget-friendly, and super comforting dish is here to save busy weeknights by combining the best of two classics.
Ingredients: 250 g spaghetti, 3 cloves garlic, 15 g fresh ginger, 3 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp sesame oil, 1 tbsp rice vinegar, 1 tsp sugar, 2 eggs, 3 scallions, 1 tsp sesame seeds, chili oil for serving, salt
Instructions: Cut the ends off the garlic and ginger and peel. Finely chop the garlic and grate the ginger. Mix together the soy sauce, sesame oil, rice vinegar, sugar, grated ginger, and chopped garlic in a bowl and set aside. Bring a large pot of water to a boil, season generously with salt, and cook pasta according to package instructions. Drain the pasta, reserving 1 - 1.5 cups of pasta water. In the meantime, bring another pot of water to a boil. Add the eggs and boil for approx. 7 min. Remove the eggs from the water and rinse them in cold water, then peel and cut in half. Cut the scallion into small slices. Add the pasta back to the pot, toss with the soy sauce mixture, and mix together, adding the reserved pasta water a bit at a time until the pasta has a glossy, slightly loose sauce. Season with more soy sauce and rice vinegar to taste. Serve pasta with jammy eggs, thinly sliced scallion, sesame seeds, and chili oil. Enjoy!
Nutrition: Cal581, Fat17 g, Protein25 g, Carb82 g
Tags: asian, weeknight dinner, vegetarian, main, pasta, for one, lactose free, Meatless, savory, frying, egg, dairy free, for two, herbs, boiling, budget-bites

Description: Creamy sun-dried tomato and Parmesan pasta so good it just might inspire a marriage proposal. This ultra-indulgent recipe combines the best of two classics.
Ingredients: 250 g penne, 3 cloves garlic, 80 g sun-dried tomatoes in oil, 5 g fresh basil, 1 tbsp olive oil, 1 tsp chili flakes, 200 g heavy cream, 200 ml vegetable broth, 60 g Parmesan cheese (grated), salt, pepper
Instructions: Finely chop the garlic and sun-dried tomatoes. Roughly chop the basil. Heat olive oil in a frying pan over medium heat, add garlic and chili flakes and saut√© for approx. 1 min. Add the sun-dried tomatoes and saut√© for approx. 2 min. more. Deglaze the pan with vegetable broth. Add heavy cream and simmer for approx. 10 min. until the sauce has thickened. Add the Parmesan cheese and stir until melted. Season with salt and pepper. In the meantime, cook pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Drain the pasta, reserving some pasta water. Add the pasta to the sauce and toss to combine, adding pasta water as needed until the sauce coats the pasta. Serve with fresh basil and more Parmesan cheese. Enjoy!
Nutrition: Cal1018, Fat66 g, Protein29 g, Carb74 g
Tags: italian, weeknight dinner, vegetarian, main, cheese, crowd pleaser, pasta, lactose free, comfort food, Meatless, european, savory, for two, dairy, vegetables, sauteing

Description: This one-pot mushroom pasta is so creamy and comforting, you'll want to make it again and again. Ready in just 35 minutes!
Ingredients: 400 g pasta, 500 g mushrooms, 1 onion, 3 cloves garlic, 800 ml vegetable broth, 200 ml heavy cream, 50 g Parmesan cheese, 5 g parsley, 2 tbsp olive oil, salt, pepper
Instructions: Slice the mushrooms. Finely chop the onion and garlic. Roughly chop the parsley. Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add mushrooms and cook for approx. 5 - 7 min. until browned. Add onion and garlic and cook for approx. 2 - 3 min. more. Add pasta and vegetable broth. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for approx. 10 - 12 min. until pasta is al dente and most of the liquid has been absorbed. Stir in heavy cream and Parmesan cheese. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with parsley and more Parmesan cheese. Enjoy!
Nutrition: Cal634, Fat26 g, Protein22 g, Carb78 g
Tags: italian, weeknight dinner, vegetarian, one pot, main, cheese, crowd pleaser, pasta, comfort food, Meatless, european, savory, for four, dairy, vegetables, sauteing

Description: This one-pot pasta alla vodka is creamy, indulgent, and ready in just 30 minutes. A weeknight dinner winner!
Ingredients: 400 g rigatoni, 1 onion, 4 cloves garlic, 2 tbsp tomato paste, 60 ml vodka, 400 ml heavy cream, 400 g crushed tomatoes, 600 ml vegetable broth, 50 g Parmesan cheese, 5 g basil, 2 tbsp olive oil, 1 tsp chili flakes, salt, pepper
Instructions: Finely chop the onion and garlic. Roughly chop the basil. Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add onion and cook for approx. 3 - 4 min. until softened. Add garlic and chili flakes and cook for approx. 1 min. more. Stir in tomato paste and cook for approx. 2 min. Add vodka and let simmer for approx. 2 min. Add crushed tomatoes, vegetable broth, and heavy cream. Bring to a boil. Add pasta and cook for approx. 10 - 12 min. until al dente, stirring occasionally. Stir in Parmesan cheese and season with salt and pepper. Serve with fresh basil and more Parmesan cheese. Enjoy!
Nutrition: Cal688, Fat35 g, Protein18 g, Carb72 g
Tags: italian, weeknight dinner, vegetarian, one pot, main, cheese, crowd pleaser, pasta, comfort food, Meatless, european, savory, for four, dairy, vegetables, sauteing

Description: This Italian classic is hearty, comforting, and packed with flavor. Ready in just 45 minutes!
Ingredients: 200 g ditalini pasta, 1 can white beans, 1 can crushed tomatoes, 1 onion, 2 carrots, 2 celery stalks, 3 cloves garlic, 800 ml vegetable broth, 50 g Parmesan cheese, 5 g rosemary, 2 tbsp olive oil, salt, pepper
Instructions: Finely chop the onion, carrots, celery, and garlic. Drain and rinse the white beans. Roughly chop the rosemary. Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add onion, carrots, and celery and cook for approx. 5 - 7 min. until softened. Add garlic and rosemary and cook for approx. 1 min. more. Add crushed tomatoes and vegetable broth. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for approx. 15 min. Add white beans and pasta and cook for approx. 10 - 12 min. until pasta is al dente. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with Parmesan cheese. Enjoy!
Nutrition: Cal505, Fat11 g, Protein21 g, Carb79 g
Tags: italian, weeknight dinner, vegetarian, one pot, soup, main, pasta, comfort food, Meatless, european, savory, for four, vegetables, sauteing

Description: Creamy, spicy, and utterly indulgent - this Cajun chicken alfredo is a crowd-pleaser! Ready in just 35 minutes.
Ingredients: 400 g fettuccine, 500 g chicken breast, 3 cloves garlic, 300 ml heavy cream, 100 g Parmesan cheese, 2 tbsp Cajun seasoning, 2 tbsp olive oil, 5 g parsley, salt, pepper
Instructions: Cut the chicken breast into bite-sized pieces and season with Cajun seasoning, salt, and pepper. Finely chop the garlic. Roughly chop the parsley. Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook for approx. 5 - 7 min. until browned and cooked through. Remove from pan and set aside. In the same pan, add garlic and cook for approx. 1 min. Add heavy cream and bring to a simmer. Add Parmesan cheese and stir until melted. Season with salt and pepper. In the meantime, cook pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Drain the pasta, reserving some pasta water. Add the pasta and chicken to the sauce and toss to combine, adding pasta water as needed. Serve with parsley and more Parmesan cheese. Enjoy!
Nutrition: Cal892, Fat46 g, Protein52 g, Carb67 g
Tags: american, weeknight dinner, main, cheese, crowd pleaser, pasta, comfort food, savory, for four, dairy, chicken, sauteing

Description: This viral TikTok feta pasta is creamy, tangy, and ridiculously easy. Just toss everything in the oven and dinner is done!
Ingredients: 400 g pasta, 400 g cherry tomatoes, 200 g feta cheese, 4 cloves garlic, 60 ml olive oil, 5 g basil, 1 tsp chili flakes, salt, pepper
Instructions: Preheat the oven to 200¬∞C/400¬∞F. Place cherry tomatoes and whole garlic cloves in a baking dish. Place the block of feta cheese in the center. Drizzle with olive oil and season with chili flakes, salt, and pepper. Bake for approx. 30 - 35 min. until tomatoes are bursting and feta is golden. In the meantime, cook pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Drain the pasta, reserving some pasta water. Remove the baking dish from the oven and mash the tomatoes, garlic, and feta together to create a creamy sauce. Add the pasta and toss to combine, adding pasta water as needed. Roughly chop the basil and stir into the pasta. Serve immediately. Enjoy!
Nutrition: Cal658, Fat33 g, Protein22 g, Carb68 g
Tags: italian, weeknight dinner, vegetarian, main, cheese, crowd pleaser, pasta, comfort food, Meatless, european, savory, for four, dairy, vegetables, baking

Description: This creamy pumpkin pasta is the ultimate fall comfort food. Sweet, savory, and ready in 40 minutes!
Ingredients: 400 g pasta, 500 g pumpkin puree, 1 onion, 3 cloves garlic, 200 ml heavy cream, 200 ml vegetable broth, 50 g Parmesan cheese, 1 tsp nutmeg, 5 g sage, 2 tbsp olive oil, salt, pepper
Instructions: Finely chop the onion and garlic. Roughly chop the sage. Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add onion and cook for approx. 3 - 4 min. until softened. Add garlic and nutmeg and cook for approx. 1 min. more. Add pumpkin puree, vegetable broth, and heavy cream. Bring to a simmer and cook for approx. 10 - 15 min. until the sauce has thickened. Stir in Parmesan cheese and season with salt and pepper. In the meantime, cook pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Drain the pasta, reserving some pasta water. Add the pasta to the sauce and toss to combine, adding pasta water as needed. Serve with sage and more Parmesan cheese. Enjoy!

Instructions: Finely chop the garlic and sun-dried tomatoes. Roughly chop the basil. Heat 2 tbsp of oil from the sun-dried tomatoes jar in a pan over medium heat. Bring to a simmer and cook for approx. 5 - 7 min. until the sauce has thickened. Stir in Parmesan cheese and season with salt and pepper. Add the pasta to the sauce and toss to combine, adding pasta water as needed. Serve with basil and more Parmesan cheese. Enjoy!

Description: This lemon butter pasta is light, bright, and ready in just 25 minutes. The perfect weeknight dinner!
Ingredients: 250 g spaghetti, 2 lemons, 100 g butter, 3 cloves garlic, 50 g Parmesan cheese, 5 g parsley, salt, pepper
Instructions: Zest and juice the lemons. Finely chop the garlic. Roughly chop the parsley. Cook pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Drain the pasta, reserving 1 cup of pasta water. In the same pot, melt butter over medium heat. Add garlic and cook for approx. 1 min. Add lemon zest and juice. Add the pasta and toss to combine, adding pasta water as needed to create a silky sauce. Stir in Parmesan cheese and season with salt and pepper. Serve with parsley and more Parmesan cheese. Enjoy!

Description: This classic Italian pasta puttanesca is bold, briny, and ready in 30 minutes. A true pantry hero!
Ingredients: 400 g spaghetti, 1 can crushed tomatoes, 100 g black olives, 50 g capers, 4 anchovy fillets, 4 cloves garlic, 5 g parsley, 3 tbsp olive oil, 1 tsp chili flakes, salt, pepper
Instructions: Finely chop the garlic, anchovy fillets, and parsley. Slice the black olives. Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add garlic, anchovies, and chili flakes and cook for approx. 2 min. until fragrant. Add crushed tomatoes, black olives, and capers. Bring to a simmer and cook for approx. 15 min. until the sauce has thickened. Season with salt and pepper. In the meantime, cook pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Ingredients: 400 g pasta, 400 g cherry tomatoes, 200 g feta cheese, 200 g spinach, 4 cloves garlic, 60 ml olive oil, 5 g basil, 1 tsp chili flakes, salt, pepper

Description: This garlic butter shrimp pasta is rich, garlicky, and ready in just 25 minutes. Restaurant-quality at home!
Ingredients: 250 g linguine, 300 g shrimp, 100 g butter, 6 cloves garlic, 1 lemon, 5 g parsley, 1 tsp chili flakes, salt, pepper
Instructions: Peel and devein the shrimp. Finely chop the garlic. Zest and juice the lemon. Roughly chop the parsley. Cook pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Drain the pasta, reserving 1 cup of pasta water. In a large pan, melt butter over medium-high heat. Add garlic and chili flakes and cook for approx. 1 min. Add shrimp and cook for approx. 3 - 4 min. until pink and cooked through. Add lemon zest and juice. Add the pasta and toss to combine, adding pasta water as needed. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with parsley. Enjoy!

Description: This creamy butternut squash pasta is sweet, savory, and perfect for fall. Ready in 50 minutes!
Ingredients: 400 g pasta, 600 g butternut squash, 1 onion, 3 cloves garlic, 200 ml heavy cream, 200 ml vegetable broth, 50 g Parmesan cheese, 1 tsp nutmeg, 5 g sage, 2 tbsp olive oil, salt, pepper
Instructions: Peel and dice the butternut squash. Finely chop the onion and garlic. Roughly chop the sage. Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add onion and cook for approx. 3 - 4 min. until softened. Add butternut squash and cook for approx. 10 - 15 min. until tender. Add garlic and nutmeg and cook for approx. 1 min. more. Add vegetable broth and simmer for approx. 5 min. Use an immersion blender to puree the sauce until smooth. Add heavy cream and bring to a simmer. Stir in Parmesan cheese and season with salt and pepper. In the meantime, cook pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Drain the pasta, reserving some pasta water. Add the pasta to the sauce and toss to combine, adding pasta water as needed. Serve with sage and more Parmesan cheese. Enjoy!

Description: This Tuscan chicken pasta is creamy, garlicky, and loaded with sun-dried tomatoes and spinach. Ready in 40 minutes!
Ingredients: 400 g penne, 500 g chicken breast, 100 g sun-dried tomatoes in oil, 200 g spinach, 3 cloves garlic, 300 ml heavy cream, 100 ml chicken broth, 50 g Parmesan cheese, 2 tbsp olive oil, 1 tsp Italian seasoning, salt, pepper
Instructions: Cut the chicken breast into bite-sized pieces and season with Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper. Finely chop the garlic and sun-dried tomatoes. Description: This creamy tomato tortellini soup is cozy, comforting, and ready in 30 minutes. Perfect for busy weeknights!
Ingredients: 400 g cheese tortellini, 1 can crushed tomatoes, 1 onion, 3 cloves garlic, 600 ml vegetable broth, 200 ml heavy cream, 50 g Parmesan cheese, 5 g basil, 2 tbsp olive oil, 1 tsp Italian seasoning, salt, pepper
Instructions: Finely chop the onion and garlic. Roughly chop the basil. Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add onion and cook for approx. 3 - 4 min. until softened. Description: This lemon ricotta pasta is creamy, bright, and ready in 25 minutes. Simple ingredients, maximum flavor!
Ingredients: 250 g pasta, 200 g ricotta cheese, 2 lemons, 3 cloves garlic, 50 g Parmesan cheese, 5 g basil, 3 tbsp olive oil, salt, pepper
Instructions: Zest and juice the lemons. Finely chop the garlic. Roughly chop the basil. Cook pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Drain the pasta, reserving 1 cup of pasta water. In a large bowl, mix together ricotta cheese, lemon zest, lemon juice, and Parmesan cheese. In a pan, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add garlic and cook for approx. 1 min. Description: This brown butter sage pasta is nutty, aromatic, and ready in 25 minutes. Elegance in its simplicity!
Ingredients: 250 g pasta, 100 g butter, 10 g sage, 3 cloves garlic, 50 g Parmesan cheese, salt, pepper
Instructions: Roughly chop the sage. Finely chop the garlic. Cook pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Drain the pasta, reserving 1 cup of pasta water. In a large pan, melt butter over medium heat. Continue cooking, stirring frequently, until the butter turns golden brown and smells nutty (approx. 3 - 5 min.). Add sage and garlic and cook for approx. 1 - 2 min. until crispy. Add the pasta and toss to combine, adding pasta water as needed. Stir in Parmesan cheese and season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately. Enjoy!

Ingredients: 250 g pasta, 100 g basil pesto, 200 ml heavy cream, 3 cloves garlic, 50 g Parmesan cheese, 5 g basil, 2 tbsp olive oil, salt, pepper
Instructions: Finely chop the garlic. Roughly chop the basil. Cook pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Drain the pasta, reserving 1 cup of pasta water. Description: The iconic Roman pasta! Creamy, eggy, and porky perfection. Ready in 25 minutes.
Ingredients: 400 g spaghetti, 200 g guanciale or pancetta, 4 egg yolks, 100 g Pecorino Romano cheese, black pepper
Instructions: Cut the guanciale into small strips. Grate the Pecorino Romano cheese. In a bowl, whisk together egg yolks, Pecorino Romano cheese, and a generous amount of black pepper. Cook pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Drain the pasta, reserving 1 cup of pasta water. In a large pan, cook guanciale over medium heat for approx. 5 - 7 min. until crispy. Remove from heat. Add the pasta to the pan with guanciale. Add the egg mixture and toss quickly, adding pasta water a little at a time until the sauce is creamy and coats the pasta. Season with more black pepper. Serve immediately. Enjoy!
Nutrition: Cal728, Fat42 g, Protein28 g, Carb56 g

Description: This Roman classic is cheese, pepper, and pasta in perfect harmony. Ready in 20 minutes!
Ingredients: 250 g spaghetti, 100 g Pecorino Romano cheese, 2 tsp black pepper
Instructions: Grate the Pecorino Romano cheese. Toast black pepper in a dry pan over medium heat for approx. 1 min. until fragrant. Cook pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Drain the pasta, reserving 1 cup of pasta water. In a large bowl, mix together Pecorino Romano cheese and toasted black pepper. Add the hot pasta and toss, adding pasta water a little at a time until the cheese melts and forms a creamy sauce. Season with more pepper if desired. Serve immediately. Enjoy!

Description: The ultimate Italian pantry pasta! Garlicky, spicy, and ready in 20 minutes.
Ingredients: 250 g spaghetti, 6 cloves garlic, 80 ml olive oil, 1 tsp chili flakes, 5 g parsley, salt
Instructions: Thinly slice the garlic. Roughly chop the parsley. Cook pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Drain the pasta, reserving 1 cup of pasta water. In a large pan, heat olive oil over medium-low heat. Add garlic and chili flakes and cook for approx. 2 - 3 min. until garlic is golden (don't let it burn!). Add the pasta and toss to combine, adding pasta water as needed. Season with salt. Serve with parsley. Enjoy!

Description: This Roman classic is tomato-y, porky, and spicy. Ready in 35 minutes!
Ingredients: 400 g bucatini, 200 g guanciale or pancetta, 1 can crushed tomatoes, 1 onion, 3 cloves garlic, 100 g Pecorino Romano cheese, 1 tsp chili flakes, 3 tbsp olive oil, salt
Instructions: Cut the guanciale into small strips. Finely chop the onion and garlic. Grate the Pecorino Romano cheese. In a large pan, cook guanciale over medium heat for approx. 5 - 7 min. until crispy. Remove from pan and set aside. In the same pan, add olive oil, onion, and chili flakes. Ingredients: 400 g rigatoni, 2 eggplants, 1 can crushed tomatoes, 4 cloves garlic, 100 g ricotta salata, 5 g basil, 80 ml olive oil, salt, pepper
Instructions: Cut the eggplants into cubes. Finely chop the garlic. Roughly chop the basil. Grate the ricotta salata. Heat half the olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Description: This spring pasta is loaded with fresh vegetables and bursting with flavor. Ready in 35 minutes!
Ingredients: 400 g penne, 200 g asparagus, 1 zucchini, 1 bell pepper, 150 g cherry tomatoes, 3 cloves garlic, 200 ml heavy cream, 50 g Parmesan cheese, 5 g basil, 3 tbsp olive oil, salt, pepper

Stir in Parmesan cheese and season with salt and pepper. In the meantime, cook pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Drain the pasta, reserving some pasta water. Add the pasta to the sauce and toss to combine, adding pasta water as needed. Serve with basil and more Parmesan cheese. Enjoy!

Description: This creamy mushroom stroganoff is rich, savory, and ready in 35 minutes. Comfort in a bowl!
Ingredients: 400 g egg noodles, 500 g mushrooms, 1 onion, 3 cloves garlic, 200 ml sour cream, 200 ml vegetable broth, 2 tbsp flour, 2 tbsp olive oil, 5 g parsley, 1 tbsp Dijon mustard, salt, pepper
Instructions: Slice the mushrooms. Finely chop the onion, garlic, and parsley. Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add mushrooms and cook for approx. 7 - 10 min. until browned. Add onion and cook for approx. 3 - 4 min. until softened. Add garlic and flour and cook for approx. 1 min. more. Add vegetable broth and bring to a simmer, stirring constantly. Cook for approx. 5 min. until the sauce has thickened. Stir in sour cream and Dijon mustard. Season with salt and pepper. In the meantime, cook pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Drain the pasta. Add the pasta to the sauce and toss to combine. Serve with parsley. Enjoy!
Nutrition: Cal668, Fat28 g, Protein18 g, Carb84 g
Tags: weeknight dinner, vegetarian, main, pasta, comfort food, Meatless, savory, for four, dairy, vegetables, sauteing

Description: This Greek pasta salad is fresh, tangy, and perfect for summer. Ready in 15 minutes!
Ingredients: 400 g pasta, 200 g cherry tomatoes, 1 cucumber, 100 g black olives, 100 g feta cheese, 1 red onion, 60 ml olive oil, 3 tbsp red wine vinegar, 1 tsp oregano, salt, pepper
Instructions: Cook pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Drain and rinse with cold water. Halve the cherry tomatoes. Dice the cucumber. Slice the black olives. Crumble the feta cheese. Thinly slice the red onion. In a large bowl, whisk together olive oil, red wine vinegar, oregano, salt, and pepper. Add the pasta, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, black olives, feta cheese, and red onion. Toss to combine. Serve chilled or at room temperature. Enjoy!
Nutrition: Cal542, Fat24 g, Protein16 g, Carb67 g
Tags: weeknight dinner, vegetarian, salad, side, cheese, pasta, Meatless, european, savory, for four, dairy, vegetables, summer

Description: This pesto chicken pasta is herby, creamy, and ready in 35 minutes. A family favorite!
Ingredients: 400 g penne, 500 g chicken breast, 100 g basil pesto, 200 ml heavy cream, 200 g cherry tomatoes, 3 cloves garlic, 50 g Parmesan cheese, 2 tbsp olive oil, salt, pepper
Instructions: Cut the chicken breast into bite-sized pieces and season with salt and pepper. Halve the cherry tomatoes. Finely chop the garlic. Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook for approx. 5 - 7 min. until browned and cooked through. Remove from pan and set aside. In the same pan, add garlic and cook for approx. 1 min. Add basil pesto, heavy cream, and cherry tomatoes. Bring to a simmer and cook for approx. 5 min. Stir in Parmesan cheese and season with salt and pepper. Add the chicken back to the pan. In the meantime, cook pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Drain the pasta, reserving some pasta water. Add the pasta to the sauce and toss to combine, adding pasta water as needed. Enjoy!
Nutrition: Cal782, Fat42 g, Protein48 g, Carb58 g
Tags: weeknight dinner, main, cheese, pasta, comfort food, savory, for four, dairy, chicken, vegetables, sauteing

Recipe Name: Pasta with white wine clam sauce
Description: This classic clam pasta is briny, garlicky, and ready in 30 minutes. A taste of the sea!
Ingredients: 250 g linguine, 500 g clams, 150 ml white wine, 4 cloves garlic, 5 g parsley, 60 ml olive oil, 1 tsp chili flakes, salt
Instructions: Scrub the clams and discard any that are open. Finely chop the garlic and parsley. Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add garlic and chili flakes and cook for approx. 1 min. Add white wine and bring to a simmer. Add clams, cover, and cook for approx. 5 - 7 min. until clams open. Discard any clams that don't open. Season with salt. In the meantime, cook pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Drain the pasta, reserving 1 cup of pasta water. Add the pasta to the clam sauce and toss to combine, adding pasta water as needed. Serve with parsley. Enjoy!
Nutrition: Cal618, Fat32 g, Protein22 g, Carb54 g
Tags: italian, weeknight dinner, main, pasta, seafood, comfort food, savory, for two, lactose free, dairy free, sauteing

Description: These Thai peanut noodles are creamy, nutty, and ready in 25 minutes. Addictively delicious!
Ingredients: 250 g rice noodles, 100 g peanut butter, 3 tbsp soy sauce, 2 tbsp lime juice, 1 tbsp honey, 1 tsp sesame oil, 1 tsp chili sauce, 3 cloves garlic, 15 g fresh ginger, 2 scallions, 50 g peanuts, 5 g cilantro
Instructions: Cook rice noodles according to package instructions. Drain and set aside. Finely chop the garlic. Grate the ginger. Slice the scallions. Roughly chop the peanuts and cilantro. In a bowl, whisk together peanut butter, soy sauce, lime juice, honey, sesame oil, chili sauce, garlic, and ginger. Add a few tablespoons of hot water to thin the sauce to desired consistency. In a large pan, toss the noodles with the peanut sauce until well coated. Serve topped with scallions, peanuts, and cilantro. Enjoy!
Nutrition: Cal688, Fat32 g, Protein22 g, Carb82 g
Tags: asian, weeknight dinner, vegetarian, vegan, main, noodles, comfort food, Meatless, savory, for two, lactose free, dairy free, herbs

Description: This Italian-American classic is creamy, indulgent, and ready in 30 minutes. A crowd-pleaser!
Ingredients: 400 g penne, 1 can crushed tomatoes, 200 ml heavy cream, 60 ml vodka, 1 onion, 3 cloves garlic, 2 tbsp tomato paste, 50 g Parmesan cheese, 5 g basil, 3 tbsp olive oil, 1 tsp chili flakes, salt, pepper
Instructions: Finely chop the onion and garlic. Roughly chop the basil. Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add onion and cook for approx. 3 - 4 min. until softened. Add garlic and chili flakes and cook for approx. 1 min. more. Stir in tomato paste and cook for approx. 2 min. Add vodka and let simmer for approx. 2 min. to cook off the alcohol. Add crushed tomatoes and bring to a simmer. Cook for approx. 10 min. until the sauce has thickened. Stir in heavy cream and Parmesan cheese. Season with salt and pepper. In the meantime, cook pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Drain the pasta, reserving some pasta water. Add the pasta to the sauce and toss to combine, adding pasta water as needed. Serve with basil and more Parmesan cheese. Enjoy!
Nutrition: Cal698, Fat38 g, Protein18 g, Carb69 g
Tags: italian, weeknight dinner, vegetarian, main, cheese, crowd pleaser, pasta, comfort food, Meatless, savory, for four, dairy, sauteing

Description: This shrimp scampi is garlicky, buttery, and ready in 25 minutes. Restaurant-quality at home!
Ingredients: 250 g linguine, 300 g shrimp, 100 g butter, 6 cloves garlic, 150 ml white wine, 1 lemon, 5 g parsley, 1 tsp chili flakes, salt, pepper
Instructions: Peel and devein the shrimp. Finely chop the garlic. Zest and juice the lemon. Roughly chop the parsley. Cook pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Drain the pasta, reserving 1 cup of pasta water. In a large pan, melt butter over medium-high heat. Add garlic and chili flakes and cook for approx. 1 min. Add shrimp and cook for approx. 3 - 4 min. until pink and cooked through. Add white wine, lemon zest, and lemon juice. Bring to a simmer and cook for approx. 2 - 3 min. Add the pasta and toss to combine, adding pasta water as needed. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with parsley. Enjoy!
Nutrition: Cal712, Fat44 g, Protein39 g, Carb52 g
Tags: italian, weeknight dinner, main, pasta, seafood, comfort food, savory, for two, dairy, sauteing

Description: This simple tomato pasta is the essence of Italian cooking. Ready in 30 minutes!
Ingredients: 400 g spaghetti, 1 can crushed tomatoes, 4 cloves garlic, 5 g basil, 60 ml olive oil, 50 g Parmesan cheese, salt, pepper
Instructions: Finely chop the garlic. Roughly chop the basil. Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add garlic and cook for approx. 1 min. until fragrant. Add crushed tomatoes and bring to a simmer. Cook for approx. 15 - 20 min. until the sauce has thickened. Season with salt and pepper. In the meantime, cook pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Drain the pasta, reserving some pasta water. Add the pasta to the sauce and toss to combine, adding pasta water as needed. Stir in basil. Serve with Parmesan cheese. Enjoy!
Nutrition: Cal498, Fat20 g, Protein16 g, Carb66 g
Tags: italian, weeknight dinner, vegetarian, main, cheese, pasta, comfort food, Meatless, european, savory, for four, dairy, herbs, sauteing

Description: This slow-cooked beef ragu is rich, hearty, and worth every minute. Perfect for Sunday dinner!
Ingredients: 400 g pappardelle, 800 g beef chuck, 2 cans crushed tomatoes, 2 carrots, 2 celery stalks, 1 onion, 4 cloves garlic, 200 ml red wine, 200 ml beef broth, 2 tbsp tomato paste, 5 g rosemary, 3 tbsp olive oil, salt, pepper
Instructions: Cut the beef into large chunks and season with salt and pepper. Finely chop the carrots, celery, onion, and garlic. Roughly chop the rosemary. Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Brown the beef on all sides (approx. 5 - 7 min.). Remove and set aside. In the same pot, add carrots, celery, and onion. Cook for approx. 5 min. until softened. Add garlic and rosemary and cook for approx. 1 min. more. Stir in tomato paste and cook for approx. 2 min. Add red wine and let simmer for approx. 3 - 5 min. Add crushed tomatoes, beef broth, and the browned beef. Bring to a simmer, then reduce heat to low. Cover and cook for approx. 2 hours, stirring occasionally, until the beef is very tender and falls apart. Shred the beef with two forks. Season with salt and pepper. Cook pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Drain the pasta. Serve pasta topped with beef ragu and Parmesan cheese. Enjoy!
Nutrition: Cal612, Fat24 g, Protein42 g, Carb52 g
Tags: italian, main, pasta, comfort food, savory, for four, beef, vegetables, autumn, winter, braising

Description: This sausage rigatoni is hearty, flavorful, and ready in 35 minutes. A family favorite!
Ingredients: 400 g rigatoni, 400 g Italian sausage, 1 can crushed tomatoes, 1 onion, 3 cloves garlic, 200 ml heavy cream, 50 g Parmesan cheese, 5 g basil, 2 tbsp olive oil, 1 tsp chili flakes, salt, pepper
Instructions: Remove sausage from casings. Finely chop the onion and garlic. Roughly chop the basil. Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add sausage and cook for approx. 5 - 7 min., breaking it up with a spoon, until browned. Add onion and cook for approx. 3 - 4 min. until softened. Add garlic and chili flakes and cook for approx. 1 min. more. Add crushed tomatoes and bring to a simmer. Cook for approx. 10 min. until the sauce has thickened. Stir in heavy cream and Parmesan cheese. Season with salt and pepper. In the meantime, cook pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Drain the pasta, reserving some pasta water. Add the pasta to the sauce and toss to combine, adding pasta water as needed. Serve with basil and more Parmesan cheese. Enjoy!
Nutrition: Cal742, Fat42 g, Protein32 g, Carb58 g
Tags: italian, weeknight dinner, main, cheese, pasta, comfort food, savory, for four, dairy, pork, sausage, sauteing

Description: This baked ziti is cheesy, saucy, and perfect for feeding a crowd. Ready in 45 minutes!
Ingredients: 500 g ziti, 1 jar marinara sauce, 400 g ricotta cheese, 200 g mozzarella cheese, 100 g Parmesan cheese, 1 egg, 5 g basil, 1 tsp Italian seasoning, salt, pepper
Instructions: Preheat the oven to 190¬∞C/375¬∞F. Cook pasta according to package instructions until just al dente (it will cook more in the oven). Drain. In a bowl, mix together ricotta cheese, half the mozzarella cheese, half the Parmesan cheese, egg, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper. In a large baking dish, spread a thin layer of marinara sauce. Add half the pasta, then dollop half the ricotta mixture on top. Spread half the remaining marinara sauce over the ricotta. Repeat layers with remaining pasta, ricotta mixture, and marinara sauce. Top with remaining mozzarella and Parmesan cheese. Cover with foil and bake for approx. 20 min. Remove foil and bake for approx. 10 min. more until cheese is golden and bubbling. Let cool for 5 min. Roughly chop the basil and sprinkle on top. Serve and enjoy!
Nutrition: Cal688, Fat28 g, Protein34 g, Carb72 g
Tags: italian, main, cheese, crowd pleaser, pasta, comfort food, savory, for four, dairy, baking

Description: This creamy chicken and mushroom pasta bake is comfort food at its finest. Ready in 50 minutes!
Ingredients: 400 g spaghetti, 400 g cooked chicken, 300 g mushrooms, 1 onion, 3 cloves garlic, 300 ml heavy cream, 200 ml chicken broth, 100 g Parmesan cheese, 50 g breadcrumbs, 50 g butter, 2 tbsp flour, 5 g parsley, salt, pepper
Instructions: Preheat the oven to 190¬∞C/375¬∞F. Shred or dice the cooked chicken. Slice the mushrooms. Finely chop the onion, garlic, and parsley. Cook pasta according to package instructions until just al dente. Drain. In a large pan, melt butter over medium heat. Add mushrooms and cook for approx. 5 - 7 min. until browned. Add onion and cook for approx. 3 - 4 min. until softened. Add garlic and flour and cook for approx. 1 min. more. Gradually add chicken broth and heavy cream, stirring constantly. Bring to a simmer and cook for approx. 5 min. until the sauce has thickened. Stir in half the Parmesan cheese and season with salt and pepper. In a large bowl, combine pasta, chicken, and sauce. Transfer to a greased baking dish. In a small bowl, mix together breadcrumbs, remaining Parmesan cheese, and melted butter. Sprinkle on top of the pasta. Bake for approx. 25 - 30 min. until golden and bubbling. Let cool for 5 min. Serve with parsley. Enjoy!
Nutrition: Cal698, Fat38 g, Protein42 g, Carb48 g
Tags: american, main, cheese, pasta, comfort food, savory, for four, dairy, chicken, vegetables, baking

Description: This gorgonzola lemon spinach pasta is creamy, tangy, and ready in 25 minutes. A sophisticated weeknight dinner!
Ingredients: 250 g pasta, 150 g gorgonzola cheese, 200 g spinach, 1 lemon, 3 cloves garlic, 200 ml heavy cream, 50 g Parmesan cheese, 2 tbsp olive oil, salt, pepper
Instructions: Zest and juice the lemon. Finely chop the garlic. Cook pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Drain the pasta, reserving 1 cup of pasta water. In a large pan, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add garlic and cook for approx. 1 min. Add heavy cream and bring to a simmer. Add gorgonzola cheese and stir until melted. Add lemon zest and juice. Add spinach and stir until wilted. Season with salt and pepper. Add the pasta and toss to combine, adding pasta water as needed. Serve with Parmesan cheese. Enjoy!

Description: This creamy leek and cheese pasta is rich, comforting, and ready in 30 minutes. A cozy dinner!
Ingredients: 250 g pasta, 2 leeks, 3 cloves garlic, 200 ml heavy cream, 100 g Gruy√®re cheese, 50 g Parmesan cheese, 2 tbsp butter, 5 g thyme, salt, pepper
Instructions: Thinly slice the leeks. Finely chop the garlic and thyme. Grate the Gruy√®re and Parmesan cheese. Cook pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Drain the pasta, reserving 1 cup of pasta water. In a large pan, melt butter over medium heat. Add leeks and cook for approx. 7 - 10 min. until very soft and slightly caramelized. Add garlic and thyme and cook for approx. 1 min. more. Add heavy cream and bring to a simmer. Add Gruy√®re and Parmesan cheese and stir until melted. Season with salt and pepper. Add the pasta and toss to combine, adding pasta water as needed. Serve immediately. Enjoy!

Description: This lazy pasta Bolognese cuts corners without sacrificing flavor. Ready in 25 minutes!
Ingredients: 400 g pasta, 500 g ground beef, 1 jar marinara sauce, 1 onion, 3 cloves garlic, 50 g Parmesan cheese, 5 g basil, 2 tbsp olive oil, 1 tsp Italian seasoning, salt, pepper
Instructions: Finely chop the onion and garlic. Roughly chop the basil. Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add ground beef and cook for approx. 5 - 7 min., breaking it up with a spoon, until browned. Add onion and cook for approx. 3 - 4 min. until softened. Add garlic and Italian seasoning and cook for approx. 1 min. more. Add marinara sauce and bring to a simmer. Cook for approx. 10 min. Season with salt and pepper. In the meantime, cook pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Drain the pasta. Serve pasta topped with Bolognese sauce, Parmesan cheese, and basil. Enjoy!

Description: This silky turmeric pasta is golden, aromatic, and ready in 25 minutes. A unique twist on classic pasta!
Ingredients: 250 g pasta, 1 tsp turmeric, 100 g butter, 3 cloves garlic, 1 lemon, 50 g Parmesan cheese, 5 g parsley, salt, pepper
Instructions: Zest and juice the lemon. Finely chop the garlic and parsley. Cook pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Drain the pasta, reserving 1 cup of pasta water. In a large pan, melt butter over medium heat. Add garlic and turmeric and cook for approx. 1 - 2 min. until fragrant. Add lemon zest and juice. Add the pasta and toss to combine, adding pasta water as needed to create a silky sauce. Stir in Parmesan cheese and season with salt and pepper. Serve with parsley. Enjoy!

Description: Spaghetti all'assassina, or assassin's spaghetti is a sensational pasta experience. Indulge in a symphony of flavors as the sauce caramelizes to create crispy, sweet tomato bits.
Ingredients: 100 g spaghetti, 150 g tomato pur√©e (passata), 2 tbsp tomato paste, 400 ml water, ¬Ω tsp chili flakes, 3 tbsp olive oil, 2 cloves garlic, 5 g parsley, 1 tsp Kitchen Stories Pasta Magie seasoning, salt
Instructions: To make the tomato broth, bring water to a boil and add tomato paste, mix to combine. Season with salt and pepper and keep warm over low heat. Peel garlic and grate finely. In a large, non-stick frying pan, heat olive oil over medium-high heat, then add garlic, chili flakes and Pasta Magie seasoning. Mix to combine. When garlic is golden brown, add tomato pur√©e and let it simmer for approx. 2 min. Then add spaghetti and let it cook in the sauce for approx. 3‚Äì5 min until the sauce caramelizes and you can see dark and crispy spots on the pasta. Gradually add some of the tomato broth prepared in the first step to the pasta, let it simmer while stirring occasionally. Repeat 3 or 4 times when pasta absorbs the liquid, until the pasta is cooked until al dente. Finely chop the parsley. When the pasta is ready, garnish with parsley and season.
Nutrition: Cal826, Fat43 g, Protein18 g, Carb97 g
Tags: italian, weeknight dinner, vegetarian, vegan, one pot, main, crowd pleaser, pasta, for one, lactose free, Meatless, Pasta Magie, savory, frying, vegetables, sauteing

Description: This is a super simple base from which to start for a quick weeknight lunch or dinner and it can be experimented with to your preferences.
Ingredients: 400 g zucchini, 200 g tagliatelle, ¬Ω lemon, 5 sprigs mint, 100 g feta cheese, pasta water, olive oil, salt, pepper, sugar
Instructions: Set a large pot of water to boil over medium-high heat. Trim ends of zucchini, and use the large holed-side of a box grater to grate the zucchini into a clean towel set inside a bowl. Use the towel to help you squeeze out as much of the extra water from the grated zucchini; discarding the liquid. Zest and juice lemon. Pluck mint leaves and thinly slice. Crumble feta cheese into a bowl. Heat a frying pan over medium heat. Add olive oil. Once hot, add grated zucchini. Season generously with salt, pepper, and a pinch of sugar and let cook, stirring occasionally, for approx. 10 ‚Äì 15 min. until it starts to brown and stick to the bottom of the pan. While the zucchini is caramelizing, season the boiling pot of water with plenty of salt and cook pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Reserve some pasta water, then drain pasta. Add cooked pasta, some pasta water, lemon juice, half the feta cheese, and half the mint to the frying pan with the caramelized zucchini. Toss everything together, adding more pasta water as needed, until a creamy sauce starts to coat the pasta. Taste and add more salt and pepper as desired. Divide evenly between serving plates and top with remaining feta, mint, and lemon zest. Serve immediately and enjoy!
Nutrition: Cal554, Fat13 g, Protein24 g, Carb87 g
Tags: italian, kid friendly, vegetarian, main, cheese, crowd pleaser, pasta, comfort food, Meatless, european, savory, fruits, for two, herbs, vegetables, spring, summer, sauteing, quick-wins

Description: Mediterranean pasta with Padr√≥n peppers, zucchini, carrot, and dried tomatoes in a savory tomato sauce.
Ingredients: 250 g pasta (e.g. orecchiette), 200 g Padr√≥n peppers, 1 zucchini, 1 carrot, 150 g dried tomatoes in oil, 400 ml pureed tomatoes, 1 red onion, 1 clove garlic, 1 chili pepper, 1 sprig rosemary, 2 sprigs thyme, 1 tsp sugar, vegetable oil for frying, salt, pepper
Instructions: Cook pasta according to the package instructions in salted, boiling water until al dente. Drain and set to one side. Meanwhile, remove the seeds from the chili pepper and chop finely. Finely dice zucchini, carrot, onion, garlic and dried tomatoes. Finely chop rosemary and thyme. Fry vegetables in some vegetable oil and season with sugar, salt and pepper. Pour in pureed tomatoes, chopped herbs, and chili. Saute for approx. 5 - 10 min. until sauce has thickened. In a second pan, fry Padr√≥n peppers in some vegetable oil and add plenty of salt. Toss the noodles in the sauce and serve in a deep dish with the fried Padr√≥n peppers on top.
Nutrition: Cal780, Fat9 g, Protein33 g, Carb135 g

Recipe Name: Pasta with sausage, tomatoes, and rosemary
Description: A hearty pasta dish with sausage, bell pepper, chickpeas, and herbs in a tomato sauce.
Ingredients: 250 g penne, 300 g sausage, 2 cloves garlic, 1 red onion, 1 bell pepper (red), 10 g rosemary, 10 g parsley, 1¬Ω tbsp olive oil, 180 g chickpeas (canned), 300 g crushed tomatoes (canned), Parmesan cheese for serving, salt, pepper
Instructions: Slice sausage into 2 cm/0.75 in. pieces. Peel garlic and onion. Finely chop garlic and cut onion into wedges. Chop bell pepper into small pieces and roughly chop rosemary and parsley. Heat olive oil in a frying pan and fry sausage, garlic, and bell pepper for approx. 2 ‚Äì 3 min., then add onion and chickpeas and fry for approx. 2 ‚Äì 3 min. more. Add tomatoes and season with salt and pepper. Let simmer for approx. 10 ‚Äì 15 min., uncovered. In the meantime, bring water to a boil in a large saucepan, add salt, and cook penne according to package instructions, until al dente. Drain penne and add to sauce. Mix in rosemary and parsley and toss to coat the pasta. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve with Parmesan cheese. Enjoy!

Tags: italian, kid friendly, weeknight dinner, salty, main, cheese, crowd pleaser, pasta, comfort food, pork, sausage, savory, for four, frying, dairy, herbs, vegetables, spring, autumn, summer, winter

Description: This simple pasta is perfect for all asparagus fans! It takes only 20 minutes and tastes deliciously summery and fresh.
Ingredients: 250 g penne, 400 g green asparagus, 2 cloves garlic, 1 lemon, 3 sprigs basil, 5 tbsp olive oil, salt, pepper, Parmesan cheese (for serving)
Instructions: Remove the woody ends from the asparagus and cut diagonally into about 2cm / 0.8 inch pieces. Finely slice the garlic. Peel the lemon and separate the segments. In doing so, collect any juices that come out. Then roughly chop the basil and set aside. Bring a large pot of water to a boil and add salt. Cook the pasta al dente according to package instructions. In the meantime, heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high and saut√© the asparagus for about 2-3 minutes. Then add the garlic and saut√©. Deglaze with about half a ladle of pasta water and, if you have any, the collected lemon juice. Drain the pasta, reserving some pasta water. Add the pasta to a pan and add pasta water again as needed. Season with salt and pepper. Finally, add the flesh of the lemon and basil and toss everything well. Serve with freshly shaved Parmesan cheese and enjoy!
Nutrition: Cal817, Fat39 g, Protein21 g, Carb98 g
Tags: italian, weeknight dinner, main, cheese, pasta, comfort food, lactose free, Meatless, european, savory, sour, fruits, frying, for two, herbs, vegetables, spring, summer, sauteing, budget-bites

Description: This simple number, using a generous amount of tomato paste as a base, is inspired by Bon Appetit's Basically recipe for rigatoni with easy vodka sauce.
Ingredients: 100 g cr√®me fra√Æche, 100 g tomato paste, 1 red onion, 3 cloves garlic, 200 g linguine, olive oil, salt, pepper, basil (for serving), grated Parmesan cheese (for serving)
Instructions: Finely chop red onion. Crush garlic cloves with the back of a knife. Pluck basil leaves. Heat a generous amount of olive oil in a pan over medium low. Add onion and crushed garlic cloves and saut√© until the onions are soft and translucent. Add tomato paste and saut√© on low for approx. 10 min. In the meantime, cook pasta according to package instructions. Drain, reserving about a cup (150 grams) of pasta water. Whisk together the cr√®me fra√Æche with half a cup of pasta water to loosen it up. Add to the frying pan over low heat and stir together, adding extra pasta water if needed until the sauce has a glossy consistency. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Before serving, add a handful of grated Parmesan to the sauce, then combine with the pasta and serve with plenty of basil leaves and more grated Parmesan on top. Enjoy!
